cont.entity_a: Zune's design is durable. Screen is bigger than the iPod Video.
cont.entity_b: Compact and lightweight design. Ergonomic design for easy handling.

cont.entity_a: Easy to load music and videos. Software interface is not intuitive.
cont.entity_b: Easy to upload music via USB. SonicStage software is not user-friendly.

cont.entity_a: Music quality isn't as good as newer Zune models.
cont.entity_b: Sound quality is excellent with customization options.

cont.entity_a: Battery life is not as long as it originally was. Battery life is good enough for two+ movies on a single charge.
cont.entity_b: Battery life is excellent with quick charging.

cont.entity_a: Software is buggy at times but usable. Needs software to be recognized by PC.
cont.entity_b: Software limits connection to one computer. Software freezes computer occasionally.

cont.entity_a: First screen has a good-sized font, but others are hard to read. Screen quality is poor. Backlighting can be uneven.
cont.entity_b: Display is hard to read in daylight.

cont.entity_a: Advertised as 30GB, but only 11.9GB is available for use. Holds up to 7500 songs and includes album art.
Does not support Windows XP Pro 64-bit systems. Does not support drag-and-drop file transfer.
cont.entity_b: Supports MP3 format. Converts MP3 files to ATRAC format.

cont.entity_a: Comes with a car accessory control plug. Accessories for Zune are hard to find compared to iPod.
Durable and works well after years. Durable and reliable over the years.
